response:
<<<api>>>: Apache POI
<<<code>>>: for (Iterator<Row> rowIterator = workbook.getRowIterator(); rowIterator.hasNext();) {
Row row = rowIterator.next();
for (Iterator<Cell> cellIterator = row.getCellIterator(); cellIterator.hasNext();) {
Cell cell = cellIterator.next();
if (cell.getCellType() == CellType.STRING) {
// parse the string value and add it to your objects
}
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: Apache POI is a powerful library that can help you parse Excel data in Java. You can use it to iterate through the rows and cells of a workbook, and extract the data you need. In the code above, you can use the `getRowIterator()` and `getCellIterator()` methods to iterate through the rows and cells of a workbook, respectively. You can then use the `hasNext()` method to check if there are more rows or cells to iterate through, and the `next()` method to get the next row or cell. You can use the `getCellType()` method to check the type of each cell, and the `getValue()` method to get the value of a cell that is of type `CellType.STRING`.
